abstract: Belgian's eschewal of patriotic displays after Brussels terrorist attacks, in favor of simple public gatherings, contrasts with French and American responses to similar events; finger-pointing among Belgians themselves has commenced, with some questioning whether country preserved by delicate political balance between diverse language and ethnic groups can effectively counter terrorism.
lead_paragraph: The attacks this week in Brussels have prompted relatively restrained displays of solidarity across the country, which has long had an identity crisis.

headline.main: In Belgium, a Country of Divisions, Patriotism Remains Subdued
headline.print_headline: In a Country of Divisions, Patriotism Is Subdued

snippet: The attacks this week in Brussels have prompted relatively restrained displays of solidarity across the country, which has long had an identity crisis.
